<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 326, 294]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 154, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/12 May/June 2017 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 435, 375]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper. Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 500, 282, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 560]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 604, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 760, 629]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 90]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 164, 561, 182]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 195, 240, 212]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 383, 244]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\),  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 242, 572, 282]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 312, 228, 329]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[242, 333, 754, 373]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 380, 495, 415]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 481, 594, 499]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 514, 156, 530]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 541, 580, 610]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 641, 242, 658]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 663, 590, 696]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 715, 593, 770]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 787, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 523, 883, 560]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = \frac{(5x^{2} + 4)^{\frac{1}{2}}}{x + 1}\). Showing all your working, find the exact value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\) when \(x = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 546, 920, 565]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 707, 92]]<|/det|>
Vectors \(\mathbf{i}\) and \(\mathbf{j}\) are unit vectors parallel to the \(x\)-axis and \(y\)-axis respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 144, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 102, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
The vector \(\mathbf{v}\) has a magnitude of \(3\sqrt{5}\) units and has the same direction as \(\mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{j}\). Find \(\mathbf{v}\) giving your answer in the form \(a\mathbf{i} + b\mathbf{j}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 116, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 272, 146, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 272, 920, 308]]<|/det|>
The velocity vector \(\mathbf{w}\) makes an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) with the positive \(x\)-axis and is such that \(|\mathbf{w}| = 2\). Find \(\mathbf{w}\) giving your answer in the form \(\sqrt{c} \mathbf{i} + d \mathbf{j}\), where \(c\) and \(d\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 291, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 526, 94, 545]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 515, 920, 562]]<|/det|>

A 5-digit number is to be formed from the seven digits 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 8 and 9. Each digit can only be used once in any 5-digit number. Find the number of different 5-digit numbers that can be formed if

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 535, 920, 567]]<|/det|>
